sentence.Network_en: They managed to shoehorn the material onto just one CD.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们设法把材料仅仅塞进一张光盘。

...些(在统一架构中的概念)它们都可以独自的成立。也就是说，即便在复杂论的牵引(allure)下，它们也不需要被硬塞(shoehorned)进去 …

entry.def: A shoehorn is a piece of metal or plastic with a slight curve that you put in the back of your shoe so that your heel will go into the shoe easily.
If you shoehorn something into a tight place, you manage to get it in there even though it is difficult.

example.ex: Their cars are shoehorned into tiny spaces...
example.tran: 他们的车硬被塞进了狭小的空间。

example.ex: I was shoehorning myself into my skin-tight ball gown.
example.tran: 我正拼命把自己塞进我的紧身晚礼服里。

means.word_mean: 1. a device used for easing the foot into a shoe
1. make fit for a specific purpose

auth_sentence.content: Some annoying habits were difficult to shoehorn into one of Moore's categories.

auth_sentence.content: Developers are on the look-out all the time, especially in the south-east of England where they can shoehorn in a few properties.

auth_sentence.content: When I stopped by the Lafayette Street branch to see if I qualified for membership, two reps did their best to shoehorn me in.
